name: Nakia Byrd
text: If I could leave 0 stars I would. How is it this is a new location and it seems the night shift on certain nights is A HOT A!! MESS!!! Is this what work looks like with a drive through line wrapped around the building while the employees turn customers away at the door..Mind you they are standing in there dancing around plus more. Oh not to mention the drug transaction that we just witnessed from an employee to a customer.. SMH SMH

name: Zipperand Stitch
text: Food is good, but I really wish dine is was open. The drive thru line is always so long.

name: Chris Clark
text: Food is pretty good but if I order 30 minutes in advance via the app for pickup I shouldn't be pulled around to wait for them to bring it out to me after spending 15 minutes in the drive thru.

name: Marcus Perry
text: Lobby closed ! Drive thru only. Shell tasted old

name: Aretha Sellers
text: Food was literally thrown together. The taco looked like it had been bitten off. This was not a good experience for a fresh opening. I'm very disappointed.

name: MADE BY CHANTELE
text: Every experience so far has been good.

name: Thomas Landers
text: One of the best Taco Bell’s I have been too. Hopefully they keep it up after the “new Taco Bell smell” fades.

name: M.G. Sturm
text: Tried get breakfast this Saturday, no one answered the drive thru. Emplyees sitting outside told us they would be open at 830am arpund  a little bit

name: Duane Anders
text: Employees do not even know when they open, was told two different times, says 7 doesn’t open until 9.

name: Austin Ya
text: I'm a little Susy baka pog

name: Shaun Powell
text: Left out half our order, won't answer phone, inside is closed so you cant go in. Food we did get was barely cooked.

name: Deborah pellem
text: This is a new one and it's close to home!❤️❤️

name: Marsha
text: Order was not accurate☹

name: Brad “Fly High” Carter
text: Incredibly slow service... Sat at the speaker for almost 10 minutes with a line of cars to the road behind us before our order was ever taken with absolutely no one in front of us. Not to mention the maybe 15 minutes we sat in line before the speaker with only 3 cars ahead of us. Finally get our food, 2 quesadillas, 2 burritos and a taco. Well they got the order right but the quesadillas where literally wadded up in the bottom of the bag..... needless to say we'll stick to the one on 72..

name: Ashley Purandare
text: My husband and I ate at Indian Kitchen in the shopping center on the corner of Whitesburg and Airport Rd. In the same place as Ruchi (they moved to south parkway just past Applebee's). Indian kitchen has a buffet everyday from 11-2,. Indian kitchen had a great amount of choices on their buffet. Try them out! I pretty much tried everything and it was all good!

resp.text: Thanks Ashley for your feedback. Glad you liked our buffet. We try to serve fresh food made from locally grown vegetables   and make sure our customers get a good choice in both vegetarian and non vegetarian. Hope to see you soon.

name: Savanna Gunn
text: I was so sad when Ruchi shut down, but heard the head chef is at Indian Kitchen so I decided to try it. 10/10 recommend it. Service was great, but the food was even better. They offer the lunch buffet on the weekends and everything was hot, fresh, and delicious!

resp.text: Thanks Savanna for your kind words and giving us such a wonderful rating. We will try to live up to your expectations. Hope to see you soon.

name: William Crane
text: Food here phenomenal! Some of the best Indian cuisine i have had in a long time. There hot is no exaggeration , it is HOT . There somsa’s are always a special treat . The staff is always very polite and pleasant , and I look forward to the next time to have the  opportunity to go

resp.text: Thanks William for taking the time to write the review and your kind words to describe the food and the service. Hope to see you soon again.

name: Caleb Harvey
text:
Worst experience I’ve ever had at a restaurant. I wouldn’t give them another penny of my business in my lifetime nor will my family.

From the moment we arrived, the two ladies running the front were extremely rude, and acted as if they didn’t want us there at all. Once we were seated, our drinks were slammed down on our table. 15 minutes passed before we saw them again to place our orders, of which we were given major attitudes.

We ordered a mango lassie, which was very gritty and was made from some sort of powder. The yogurt tasted rotten, and we told the server about it. She snatched it off our table, and rolled her eyes.

While we were here, and the 15 minutes passed by, we saw two other tables get up and walk out without ordering because of the terrible customer service given to them by the “manager”. Please roll back your cameras and watch people walking out after encountering the most rude servers/managers in Huntsville.

The rice was so dry, we asked for a different entree. Once we got the bill, she refused to take off the drink that cost $3.99 because we took one single sip out of it to find it wasn’t good, and the yogurt was sour. She said “you took a sip so you’re paying for it”. I told her that was ridiculous, that it was rotten, and she rolled her eyes, snatched my debit card from my hand and charged it.

I asked where the manager was, and she said “I’m the manager” and laughed. I truly hope the owners read this review because I have been a very loyal customer to this location, and the chef despite the Ruchi drama. Now I’ve decided to never come back here. If the owners are reading this, please take this seriously and do something about these two because they are running off loyal customers.

resp.text: Hi Caleb I appreciate the review and your experience at the restaurant. We spoke to the staff about their behavior and their attitude towards our customers. We gave them a verbal warning regarding their service towards you and your family. Just give us one more chance so that next time you come to the restaurant you can have a good and better experience. Hope to see you soon.

name: RalphFLA
text:
I have never eaten in a real Indian restaurant before--just a couple of small take-out stands in large cities.

The person with whom I was dining has had experience dining in Indian restaurants so I followed his lead and my own instincts based on what type of food I generally like.

One of my favorite foods, and one that I do not often get to eat, is lamb. With that in mind, I decided to try the Lamb Tikka Masala. It was served in a metal bowl. There were a great deal of lamb in the mixture (see the photo). There was also a lot of it. I ate about half of the dish and got a take-out box for the remainder to enjoy it later.

It was a tomato cream sauce with spices harboring a different flavor than I am used to experiencing. It looked like a thick tomato bisque soup and had some tomato flavor but with different spices.

I also had a Naan bread to accompany the dish. It was very much like the pita bread often served in Greek restaurants and had a similar flavor. There were four large slices of bread.

Overall, the meal was very filling.

My dining companion ordered the Tandoori chicken. It is pieces of chicken with yogurt and spices and cooked in a clay oven. I had one of the chicken pieces and liked it very much. Again, a different spice than I am used to having but it tasted good.

The chicken was served on a plate that was sizzling when it came out. Obviously, it was very hot and an impressive presentation with the chicken sizzling rapidly.

For a drink, I ordered Masala Tea. Again, I had never had this tea and ordered it on a whim. It was very good. Strong black tea with milk and spices, probably cinammon and some other spices. It was robust and filling and served hot.

This restaurant is in the back of a shopping center and can be easy to miss. Until we got close, I did not see the sign although we were looking for it.

The meal was tasty and the prices were very reasonable. The servings were generous and many adults will have food left over to take home for another meal.

For those who have not tried Indian cuisine, this would be a good place to start.

resp.text: Thanks Ralph for you good review. We were happy that you had a wonderful experience at this restaurant. Thanks once again for recommending this place to other people. We need loyal customers like you so we can improve on the quality and quantity of food. Hoping to see you again.

name: San
text: Newly opened Indian Kitchen have delicious food, right now they are only doing takeout but owner who is also chef said they will be open for dine in soon.

resp.text: Thanks Santosh for your feedback. We will try to open the dine in soon. Just waiting as a precautionary measure to open the dine in because of the Covid. Till then you can do takeout and enjoy the food.

name: Will Sanders
text: From the moment we walked in, we were treated poorly. It took 15 minutes to even get someone to our table. Several patrons walked out the restaurant due to the lack of service. This should’ve been my first indication. We received our food, the food was ok, but we asked for a few things to be taken off. When the bill came the “manager” said since you “tired the food and drink we can’t take it off”. This makes no sense to me… I swiped my card then she turned the screen and I’m not sure if she tipped her self, or changed the amount. She also forged my signature to be able authorize the purchase. This is not right, and I recommend never eating at this restaurant.

resp.text: Thanks Will for your feedback. We spoke to the staff and gave them verbal warnings about their behavior towards our loyal customers. Don't worry they did'nt overcharge you or took off any tips. Please try to come back again and have a good experience at this restaurant. Hope to see you again.

name: Rebecca Booth
text: All I can say is WOW! I have been to India several times and I can honestly say this is THE MOST Authentic Indian food i have had stateside.  Their fresh ingredients and great prices will definitely have you coming back for more.  Do yourself a favor,  stop and experience the BEST Indian food around. You won't be disappointed!!

resp.text: Thank you Rebecca for your kind words and your good review. Hope it guides other people to our restaurant who are craving for good authentic Indian food

name: grey ish
text:
This is one of the best restaurants in the city. Not one of the best Indian cuisine restaurants, of which there are too few. One of the very best, any cuisine, any style.

We have enjoyed a few very nice Indian restaurants in the area over the years, but they closed down or were sold. We have been craving a place like this and when we saw it was open, we took a chance. Long story short, we we back two days later.

Tried a few different entrees, naan, samosas, and a few cauliflower dishes. The Gobi Manchurian is a real treat. And the samosas with the mint chutney/sauce.... I put the leftover sauce on a sandwich.

This is a bit of a hidden spot but I really hope everyone goes there. They are making amazing food.

resp.text: Thank you for the good review and the 5 stars you gave for the restaurant. Hope your review helps us to get more customers so we can serve them good and authentic food.  Hope to see you soon again.

name: Dr. David Thomas
text: Very rude, I would not recommend. We left without ordering. I will never come here again.

resp.text: Hi Dr. David, can you please call us and let us know your bad experience with us. In that way we can take the necessary action against any staff who made your experience a bad one. We hope to see you again and make you our loyal customer.

name: J. Berger
text: Excellent food. Always delicious and fresh!

resp.text: Thanks Ms. Berger for your good review about the food. We have a lot of choices on the menu. Hope you will like it and enjoy. See you soon.

name: Jonathan Korbell
text: Unimpressed, unamused, and displeased with the rude staff. The Mango Lassie is powder based, and not fresh. Quite sour on the palate.

resp.text: Thanks Jonathan for your feedback. We tried to brief the staff about their behavior. Regarding Mango Lassi we do not use any powder. We make it fresh on order. Maybe you liked it sweet. Next time let us know and we will make it to your order. Thanks and hope to see you soon.

name: Joel Gaddis
text: Amazing food, so much flavor!!! And the dining room is now open!  If you are reading this: close your app and just go here!!!! Seriously, this is some of the best food I have eaten. Definely the best Indian food.  I can say that the lamb vindaloo, coriander chicken, and chicken 65 were delicious.

resp.text: Thank you Joel for the amazing review you gave for the restaurant. Hope it guides people to our restaurant who appreciates a good quality of Authentic Indian food.

name: Sierra Belle
text: The Butter chicken-spicy was phenomenal! My fiancé got the lamb Roganjosh and really enjoyed that as well. It was our first time trying Indian food and we will definitely be back. Everything we got was amazing down to the Naan and the dessert. 10/10 would recommend. Price wasn’t bad for the portion size either.

resp.text: Thanks Sierra for the good review you gave for our restaurant. Glad your first time was a good experience. Hope to see you and your fiance next time.

name: Jalen Johnson
text: Would not recommend eating here. The service is horrible.

resp.text: Hi Jalen sorry for your bad experience you had  at this restaurant. We have taken the necessary action against the staff. Hope you will have a good experience the next time you dine in. See you soon.

name: Sherman Wilcox
text: Excellent food, nice to have a great neighbourhood Indian restaurant

resp.text: Thanks Sherman for the 5 Stars. Its nice to have you Sherman in our Good Customer list.

name: damintrading trading
text: Worst restaurant ever. I ordered food for the family and everyone got major upset stomach. I called just now to complain and the girl who answered the phone told me that there are lot of diseases out there and it wasn’t them instead of admitting her mistake. Just to know I wasn’t looking for either a compensation or my money back. Just wanted them to acknowledge.  Please order from here if you definitely want diarrhea

resp.text: Sorry to hear that you had a bad experience at our restaurant. We take these reviews very seriously. We investigated the case and found out there were so many orders on that day when you ordered but you were the only one whom we learnt had a problem with the food. Maybe it was just a coincidence that you ordered food on that day and we got the blame for it. Anyways give us one more chance and you might give us a good rating next time you visit.

name: Anthony
text: I have been waiting for some good Indian restaurants to come to Huntsville. The other options don’t meet my expectations by a long shot. Indian kitchen is your best option in Huntsville by far. Much better flavors, slightly larger portions, and better heat levels. The lamb was hit or miss. Some pieces were tender and moist, but most were dry and chewy. Really wish this restaurant would sell papadums. It’s a very common item to find in Indian restaurants so I’m not sure why they don’t have them. Overall a big step up from the other Indian restaurants. Looking forward to trying many other dishes

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback. Try our other dishes too from the menu. Hope to see you soon.

name: Cameron Blake
text:
Super friendly service and amazing food.

The butter chicken is exceptional and pairs perfectly with the garlic naan.

resp.text: Thank you Cameron for the  review. Try other dishes too which are equally good so next time you have a choice to select. Hope to see you again.

name: battenro
text: If, like myself, you crave authentic Indian curry with all the spice and taste you could ever want than this is the place for you. You can have your curry as mild or as hot as you want and it’ll still be the best in Alabama.

resp.text: Thank you very much battenro for your good review. Hope it helps other people who are craving for authentic Indian food. Thanks once again and we will try our best to keep up the good work.

name: Yasir Afzal
text: Amazing food. Don't forget to try their buffet from Friday to Sunday.

resp.text: Thanks Yasir for the 5 Stars and the good review. Hope to see you soon.

name: Angela Keys
text: My husband and love Indian food and this is by far the best we've had in town.  The spice is right, the price is right, and the portions are generous.  My children even love it!

resp.text: Thank you for leaving us a rating of your experience at our business. We hope to see you again.

name: Erik Walsh
text: Really good! Friendly staff. Everything was great!

resp.text: Thanks Erik for your wonderful review. We are striving to keep up to the standard and the quality of the food. Hope to see you soon.

name: Brandon Hardiman
text: The reviews sound great but good luck eating at this place. Every time I call to place an order I get a busy signal or hung up on.

resp.text: Hey Brandon we apologize about your experience. We just investigated the problem and tried to fix it. You can try to order now and enjoy your favorite Indian food.

name: Kelsey Ballard
text: Best Indian food in Huntsville! I will miss this place when we move :( Awesome butter chicken, palek paneer, tikka masala, garlic naan!!!! it’s fast, always hot, perfect spice level, and huge portions!

resp.text: Thanks for the review Kelsey. Its sad to hear about your moving but till then you can enjoy the amazing food. Hope to see you again.

name: Lisa GV
text: This is the absolute best Indian food!! We recently moved to North Alabama from Colorado, and I didn't expect to find the most delicious chicken tikka masala, Peshwari naan, and gulab jamun I've ever had right here in Huntsville. The flavor and quality is amazing! This place is well worth the drive for us, and I can't wait to try more items from their large menu. Also, they were open for dinner dine in service tonight (June 26, 2021). I hope more people discover and support this delicious restaurant, as I'd love to see them one day expand and build additional locations in the Madison or Athens areas! :)

resp.text: Thank you Lisa for the best review. Its our pleasure serving your family. Hope to see you again soon in the future.

name: Watching You
text: Wow what can I say . The cook NO he is not a cook he’s maker of art in Preparing Indian food with class Namaste to the chef  found a new home to eat

resp.text: Thanks for your review. Glad you liked our food and made our place your home to eat. You will be always welcome. Hope to see you soon.

name: Katie Duncan
text: The best Indian restaurant in Huntsville. Their butter chicken is amazing!

resp.text: Thank you Katie for the good review. Hope you try other dishes from the menu. All are amazing made from fresh ingredients and locally shopped.

name: Sarah Mayers
text: Best Indian food in huntsville. Get the chicken tikki masala and you won’t regret it 🤌🏼

resp.text: Thanks Sarah for your feedback. Hope you try other dishes from our menu. See you soon.

name: Dylan Lawson
text: Some of the best spicy food I have ever had, excited about this again and again!

resp.text: Thank you Dylan for the good review and we are glad to have you as a regular customer. Hope we keep our good relationship

name: Tanu Singhal
text: Tried this place and it’s awesome. The owner is very friendly.  The food quality is super good and the quantity is just the perfect amount.  They definitely have my business.  I am very picky when it comes to food and this place meets my expectations! Thx  AJ

resp.text: Thanks Tanu for your feedback. And we are glad that we meet your expectations in regards to the food. We try our best to use the local grown fresh ingredients so our customers can get a good taste of the food. Hope to see you soon.

name: James
text:
Easily the best indian restaurant in huntsville.

Portions for the price is exactly what you would expect.

Quality is consistent. Food is rich in flavor as you would expect from indian food.

The chief is clearly passionate and it really does come out in his food. Hope this restaurant keeps its consistency and wish them the best. Give this place a try you won't regret it.

resp.text: Thanks for your feedback. We will try our best to keep up the consistency of the food. Thanks once again James.

name: Matthew B.
text: Rude staff, charged for drink we asked to be sent back, PHYSICALLY snatched my card from me so they could charge it without any sense of hospitality. Terrible service. Hope this place burns.

resp.text: Hi Matthew sorry for the terrible experience you had from our staff. We have taken the necessary action against the staff and we promise you wont be disappointed the next time you come in.

name: Yasmin Baria
text: We ordered takeout twice and the food was delicious, great quality & quantity and authentic. A must try.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave your feedback. We hope to see you again.

name: Jeremy Lawson
text: Unfreakinbelievable!!! THIS is the place to go for Indian. Loved when Ruchi was there but since they moved, their food hasn't been as good. Not sure what happened but what they lost, Indian Kitchen found. Hoping Ruchi figures it out but until then, Indian Kitchen is the place for us!

resp.text: Thanks Jeremy for your feedback. We would like to keep up the good work and make sure customers keep coming back. Hope to see you soon.

name: Vanessa Coutinho
text: The best Indian food ever. I would recommend this restaurant as it has quality food with reasonable price also the stuff is super friendly. I had chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, vegetable samosas.

resp.text: Thank you for leaving us a rating of your experience at our business.We hope to see you again.

name: Sam Sungg
text: Impudent staff members. Won’t be back.

name: Sean Kruer (Normal Human Person)
text: Very tasty! Great portions, great flavor!

resp.text: Thank you Sean for the 5 stars and the good review.

name: Nick Rainosek
text: Great food, great service!!

resp.text: Thanks Nick for your good review. Hope to see you soon again.

name: Annika Rettstadt
text:
Indian Kitchen is where it's at!! My boyfriend and I were visiting from out of town and love Indian food, so we decided to order from Indian Kitchen on a whim. We were not disappointed! This is a mom and pop store hidden away in an outlet mall. Please support small and local businesses!

We ordered two vegetarian entrees: Palak Paneer and Paneer Tikka Masala. We also ordered the Mixed Vegetable Pakora appetizer, and a side of Garlic Naan. I will say that this is a LOT of food for two people since the portions were huge (we have days worth of leftovers) and we were served rice to compliment our meals. All of the food was absolutely delicious, and I look forward to returning to Indian Kitchen very soon.

resp.text: Thanks Annika for your feedback. We are glad you and your boyfriend liked the food. Hope to see you soon.

name: Taylor Satula
text:
Really impressed with the food me and my significant other ordered. We got a spread just to try it out and everything we ordered was delicious.

We got palak paneer, panner tikka masala, naan, (a boatload of) rice, mixed vegetable pakora, and it came with mint sauce and tamari sauce.

The paneer was firm with a great mild flavor. You could tell it was made fresh by the firm bouncy texture.

The spinach and the tikka masala sauces were nice and thick. Just the right amount of good spices talking to each other in the sauce.

Naan had great crispy tips and was also clearly homemade

Pakora was KILLER dipped in the mint sauce

I will absolutely be going back to Indian kitchen. It was a little bit hard to find because they don’t have an illuminated sign yet. It has a red curtain draped out front. Staff was very nice and I have nothing but good to say about it,,,,, it was just a really good spot. Glad they’re near my house.

resp.text: Thanks Taylor for the feedback. Now with your comparison we know where we stand. We will try our best to give our best in terms of food. See your soon.

name: Amy Ragan
text:
I was loyal to Ruchi when they were at this location. Tonight my husband and I did a taste taste between the newly-relocated-Ruchi and the newly-opened-Indian Kitchen. We got a medium chicken tikka masala and a garlic naan takeout from both restaurants at the same time.

Indian Kitchen’s curry was thicker and more flavorful, and their chicken looked like it had been nicely charred. Ruchi’s gravy was thin and much more bland, and the chicken was dry and kinda sad looking.

The rice and naan were pretty comparable for both, but Indian Kitchen’s naan was totally loaded up with garlic so it had more yummy garlic flavor.

We did not expect this outcome! We just thought it would be fun to compare. But it looks like we will be returning to Indian Kitchen!

resp.text: Thanks Amy for your feedback and  for the hardwork you and your husband did to compare the food. We will try to keep up the good work and keep the consistency in terms of the food. Hope to see you soon.

name: Lauren Badia

When I pulled back through and politely asked for more sauce, the bespectacled red-headed young lady expediting for the window made a sickly exaggerated smirk at me and then tossed an armful of sauce packs into a bag. The young man at the window then handed the bag to me with an amused grin and without comment. There were 54 packs -- I counted them later out of curiosity. I'll never visit this location again.

The food should be severed fresh regardless of the fact of it being fast food. No one should have to pay for food that’s has been sitting under a warmer too long. Every time I have ordered a chalupa it was hard as a brick and I didn’t even feel like disputing it. The ONLY chalupa that I have eaten, “that was actually fresh”, was the chicken bacon ranch chalupa that was there for a limited amount of time and they had no choice but to make it fresh because it probably wasn’t at high demand. I’ll probably never eat there again now that I have made this post, but something needs to be done. Work ethics and training needs to be reevaluated. They should not make you go park when you are at the drive-through window you should wait on your food so you don't have to be trapped for 30 minutes in cars. text:
Just pulled in and out of the drive through again. Apparently they have discontinued the Mexican pizza. The Mexican pizza was one of the only things in the menu unique to the chain. Everything else is better at a sit down Mexican restaurant. Now my decision to eat here will only be for quick food when I can not sit down at a restaurant.  This decision will cut my visits to Taco Bell by 70%. I use to go to Taco Bell 3+ times a week. Thank god for the party pack nachos, while they last. For today my money went to Jacks :(

I can only imagine someone did not do a proper cost benefit analysis on this decision. While it may look like they lost out in a Mexican pizza sale. In reality the Mexican pizza was my reason for stoping at Taco Bell. This was the unique item I could not get anywhere else. Once I was at the window for a Mexican pizza I would then add on the other 6-7 dollars Of menu items. I definitely do not crave an over priced taco or a burrito that has all beans..

Some days it is excellent. Others your order is wrong or there is about half the food in the shell/wrap that corporate says there should be. Some days they wear masks, others they don't. Other days employees smoke next to the drive through line.

Its the roll of the dice any particular day what will happen when you visit. Be prepared to check your food before pulling away. And 99% of the time you have to ask for a receipt...which would be only a minor annoyance if they didn't act like you were asking them for super special treatment for such a simple thing that should be standard anyway.

name: Ralph Freeman
text:
My wife and I decided to get some breakfast on our way out to roam as we are oft to do. We had been hearing about Brick and Spoon for a while and decided that today was the day to give them a try.
Not surprisingly, Brick and Spoon was busy so we decided to sit at the counter rather than wait the current thirty minute waiting time. After scanning the menu, I decided to order the Killer Creole Omelette with breakfast potatoes and my wife ordered The Grown Up BLT. Our meals were delicious, the waitstaff attentive without overdoing it, the servings of adequate proportions and the prices reasonable. Brick and Spoon won’t be my new go to breakfast spot but I do recommend it and will return.

name: Kristen Blaylock
text: Dangerous!! Update, and response to owner***The coffee shop has closed down, but instead of notifying Google, and thanking their patrons by adding a notification to the phone number, they surrounded the property with dangerous dogs. They are VERY AGGRESSIVE! Please do not try to park in the lot or you might be bitten. If they don't rectify this situation I foresee a lawsuit in the near future. Update:  The closed sign can NOT be seen over the truck parked in the lot if you are pulling in from the double springs side. Regardless. Most people are looking for parking not for a closed sign before pulling in. I'd like to know how many places of business you go to that you circle looking for closed signs before heading to the parking lot. Google says you were open. You can update that, and you have the responsibility to. My young daughter was almost bitten by your dangerous dogs. Unfortunately, you won't have my business again. It is not acceptable to claim you are trying to protect patrons by getting them bitten by your dogs. If you can't update review sites with proper information, then your patrons will. Put up a barrier across the lot if you want to ensure people don't enter. You're not trying to keep out invaders. You're trying to protect future patrons. Act like it.

resp.text: The Coffee House is currently under renovations and is closed - Temporarily. Please abide by our prominently displayed CLOSED sign. There are many construction projects currently ongoing and we are not open to the public to ensure their safety.

name: Melissa Simmons
text: After waiting a whole year I found out this location has gotten 10x worse I went to purchase food today from this location when I got home and looked at the food it looked horrible the taco was soggy and the quesadilla was burnt and to add on they got my two supreme tacos wrong and when I went to return them after biting half of one and realizing it wasn’t what I paid for the lady asked for the food back which was a big NO NO with COVID-19 and other viruses you should never receive food that has been in someone else’s possession and I witnessed other employees opening the food which I had took bites out of and still preparing food (CROSS-CONTAMINATION!!) The employee and manager refused to give me two supreme tacos because one had been bitten out of and I got shorted my money because she did not give me the taco I had took a bite out of and after I received the replacement I did not feel like eating it because of the cross-contamination. This is a breeding ground for all types of illnesses the window they are serving out of has dirt piled on it and finger smudges and from what I’m told this is nothing new. Every single one of the afternoon shift employees (and managers) need to get retrained on their customer service skills and cross-contamination.

resp.text: That's not okay, Melissa. We want to know more. Please DM us on Twitter @TacoBellCare.

I hadn't paid for anything this time. I told them that was incorrect and they took the food back from my car window and HAD TO ORDER AGAIN. Then, when I FINALLY got home....MY FOOD WAS BARELY WRAPPED AND WAS DUMPED OUT OF THE SHELLS AND DIRECTLY INTO THE BOTTOM OF THE BAG. The employees here are a disgrace and it's amazing that they were even able to land a job in the first place. It's really a sad thing to see.

text: I'm very picky about breakfast burritos, and most places get them too greasy and falling apart. But the burrito I had here they toast it like a panini so it doesn't fall apart and it was the best tasting burrito! Sausage, cheese, egg, onions, peppers. I asked for extra cheese and a cup of salsa. Best breakfast I've had in awhile. And it was more than enough, I was worried about not having a side but I couldn't even finish my burrito.

It was frothy so he got the milk part right I just don't know about the rest of it.  I did think at the time he made it awfully quick and I commented on that to him after all a 2 shot espresso latte takes a few minutes to make. I guess he must of just left out my 2 shots. Waste of $4.  I would have return to cafe but I  was almost home before I tried the drnk and I don't live in Arab.

resp.text: I’m so sorry that you didn’t enjoy your coffee! The gentleman that made your coffee today has many years of experience as a barista and since our opening in May, we’ve  had nothing but positive feedback on anything he’s made. Next time you are in town, we’ll be happy to refund your coffee or make you another one on the house! Again, I’m terribly sorry you didn’t enjoy your experience and we’d love the opportunity to try again!

text: I cannot believe the level of problems with my experience. We finally decided to do fast food after over 2 months. I was the only person in line and tried to use the app to order, and the app was down, we called in to make sure we can do drive through. I literally read the order off the app in the drive through very slowly and very carefully. The manager was running the drive through order taking. I spent $29.57 at about 9 pm on 5/17/20. I received half my order, it was cold, some double wrapped in tortillas. 100% not the correct portions, ingredients and not even close to the food I ordered. I left with about $10 worth of cold food. When i called back the response i recieved was to come back for the missing items sometime in the next few days. We took picture to send to the complaint department. Very very disappointing experience

text: Apparently lunch rush hour is the time where they decide that working on their monitors is a great choice. And they are apparently incapable of walking the 10 ft to front counter registers. There are 4-5 cars in front of us and 3 behind us. We are stuck. How exactly are we supposed to just come inside? Takes about 10 minutes for the cars to start moving out of the line. Needless to say, we did come in and won't be coming back due to the incompetence and lack of management. P.S. They always run out of Baja Blast at this store consistently so good luck if that is the reason you are stopping by this place. They also skimp out on the chicken in the quesadillas so if you enjoy paying chicken quesadilla prices for a cheese quesadilla then you will love this store.

text: This location sells stale cinnamon twists. They also disrespect customers by refusing to hand them their change when you ask for a refund for the stale cinnamon twist. As a general manager of a restaurant I know how disrespectful it is when a customer sets their change down on the counter and I also know that the manager did so on purpose just to be disrespectful. I honestly cannot believe that this company would employ such a rude person, and then promote that person to a manager.

name: Pasky Pasky
text:
NEVER skip checking your bag(s) after going through the drive through at this location. Your order is guaranteed to be wrong 9 times out of 10, and they will neglect to give you some of the items you paid for. To top that off, the items you managed to receive will likely not be made properly. I can't tell you how many times my grilled chicken quesadilla was steak or shredded chicken (yuck) instead. I've also ordered extra cheese or meat on multiple occasions in the past, only to be given *less* than the normal amount.

To make matters worse, the staff is very slow and extremely rude. They never apologize when they mess up orders; it's pretty obvious they don't care due to their passive attitudes.

Management: Please make sure your employees know that it is not appropriate to not give the customer what they paid for. It's making this location look very bad, especially considering how amazing the Alabaster location is. I don't think I'll bother here anymore.

I ordered this for dine in but after being in the restaurant for 20 min I was tired of hearing 2 kids screaming and running around I asked them to give me the food to go. text: This tea room is wonderful. The food is delicious. Tea service consists of a three tiered tray of goodies; scones, finger sandwiches and desserts. There is plenty of food and teapots are refillable. If you are extra hungry I highly recommend the quiche and strawberry soup. Reservations are required to ensure a table is available.

text: This was a very great experience. The atmosphere is pleasing and relaxing. The food was fresh and delicious.The presentation was very sophisticated and the owner is lovely and very professional. It is RESERVATION ONLY so make sure to call ahead. I would definitely recommend.

name: Mariana Sandifer
text: Visiting from out of town and I drove past this place a few times and was intrigued...the reservation-only was weird to me, but so so glad I went! This place is a gem. The whole experience was amazing! They checked all the boxes, great tea, food, service, ambience. I really wish there were more tea rooms like this across the country, I would come here monthly if I lived here. Lovely place for a ladies' afternoon.

text: Lovely! And the food was great. It was the perfect place for me to bring my friends.

name: Brandy Moncibais
text: Nice place and the tea is smooth.

name: Jason Willis
text: Had an amazing time, first ever tea room experience. Great tea and food. Reservations only so call ahead, but definitely recommend making this a place to visit.

name: S. Dianne Baker
text: This is a wonderful place to come a lone, meet or bring friend's and family. The tea and food are so awesome. The presence of the LORD is all over the area. You should truly check this place out, but remember IT'S BY APPOINTMENT ONLY!!!!

name: N'Gina Pearson
text: I had my daughter's birthday party her. Ms. Janice  (The owner) was very accommodating and her waitresses were amazing and patient with the children. The food was fresh and really good. The selection of teas were outstanding. I will absolutely be back.

name: Beverly Craft
text: Always delicious and always a blessing. Beautiful cards and China in gift shop. My family goes at least once a month with friends. Reservations needed.

name: Cindy Keeping
text: Wonderful service snd food... perfect place to meet with friends and enjoy their company in a beautiful relaxing environment 🌸

name: Marie Lundbom
text: Wonderful food, atmosphere and the owner is very friendly!

name: Evelyn Moreira
text: Excellent experience.  The Tea Room is a beautiful place to visit and take a friend or two to enjoy a delectable meal in a peaceful, quiet setting.  I took my daughter, who was visiting from out of town.  We reminessed her childhood days of tea parties, all dolled up with friends and tea sets served with pastries and petite sandwiches.  The Christmas tree decorated with tea cups and tea pots was exquisitely displayed. Enjoy!!!

name: Alyssa Godfrey
text: A very enjoyable tea house. This is missing the Victorian/antique feel, but still a very nice atmosphere. The scones are amidst always slightly overcooked, and the cream/curd you have to share with the whole table, but not a deal breaker. As a whole, the food is really good. The tea selection is very limited, and they are often sold out of the tea you order. They often sell out of certain menu items before close of business.

name: Betty Sue Moore
text: A special place for a fun day lunch with friends.  Loved the strawberry kiwi tea and chicken crepes.  A good day with friends.

name: Cheryl Jarrell
text: Fluffy, delicious spinach quiche & "to die for" grape salad with peach apricot tea.  So peaceful and relaxing.

name: Amanda Lynch
text: Amazing service!  Amazing food!  We love the Gazebo Tea Room!

name: Renee Hutchinson
text: Great quiche and delicious scones. However the scones were so tiny. I have never seen them so small. So they should give more than 2 if so small. Especially since that is the draw.

name: Sherry Calloway
text: Such a delightful place! The food is delicious!

name: Heather Rollins Shores
text: A neat experience, especially if you have daughters. Great tea selections and I LOVE the scones. Theirs is the only chicken salad that my daughter will eat!

name: Joyce Vaughn
text: It's absolutely delightful! The service is great and there are many tea selections. It's a unique experience for Montgomery, AL. 😊

name: Abigail Hipps
text: I would love to give a detailed review, but this Tea Room is not open unless you make a reservation. Because there is no website to tell me this, I only found out when I drove out during "open" hours, only to be greeted by a locked door. Very disappointed by the lack of communication.

name: Rebecca Golden
text: I came away hungry but it was because I don't like desserts so I skipped the sweets

name: Terry Chilton
text: Very nice experience, especilly for ladies & little girls. Gentlemen would like it too!

name: Barbara Straw

name: Nicole Bowen

name: Debbie Hodge
text: Great restaurant and coffee shop in downtown Alexander City. Stop in for excellent coffee and delicious breakfast waffles, omelettes, muffins, scones and other delicious things. Then for lunch stop in and grab a taco or a burrito.  You will not be disappointed. As I continue to go in here to eat I find more and more things I like. They have breakfast bowls made up fresh ready to go if you are in a hurry—delicious! Also some Saturdays they set up a omelette bar inside the eating area. I cannot say enough about this restaurant.

resp.text: Thanks Debbie! We appreciate the feedback and glad you enjoy our food and coffee! We look forward to seeing you again soon! - Tony & Kurt

I love this place!! Great food, great music, and great coffee!

text: I have to say that it's a wonderful establishment with an amazing staff. And they have a wide variety of things to choose from. I'd like to congratulate and thank everyone who works at the coffee corner for such a great job. Keep up the good work and may God bless you.

resp.text: Hey Tommy, thanks a lot for the review! We are glad you enjoy our place as much a we do!

text: High school kids making coffee... we ordered cappuccino and the kids asked each other "do we know how to make one?". Half an hour wait.. they screwed up orders of multiple people. The place looks cool,  but you may want to avoid this place if you see kids managing it.

resp.text: Hey Vinamra, we are very sorry you did not experience the kind of quality we wish for all of our guests to have. We really appreciate your feedback as we will use that to continuously improve our customer service and our training. We hope that you give us another chance to impress you and give you the kind of customer service you and everyone of our  guests deserve!

name: Reese Stewart
text:
Great location and atmosphere.
Decor is pleasant and great view of the surrounding town.

Recommendation to owner:
Get a liquid sweetener for your iced selections. Getting sugar to dissolve in ice cold coffee is problematic and detracts from the experience here.

The soap in the restroom was empty and its right next to the kitchen which was mildly concerning.

Overall i enjoy my visits here. But room for improvement.

name: Dylan Dunn
text:
Edit: The movie is an interesting idea, and I thouroghly enjoyed it, but the time frame in which it aired prevented me from ordering close enough to the presentation to enjoy the food while watching the movie unless I decided to hold out on eating. I still think there are better options for Mexican food in the area, but this business responded well. I apologize for the rather harsh criticism from earlier, but I still think that an improved menu layout and a look somewhat arbitrary supreme prices would be helpful.

"The event I attended was ill planned and started late as a result. Furthermore the food I recived was cold, and it was not worth the extra dollar for a peddley line of sour cream. I'm generally not picky, but the flavors were questionable at best. The menu was unclear and the cashier even had issues relaying information to the kitchen. Not sure about the coffee, but I would shy away from the Taco Bar."

resp.text:
Hey Dylan, I’m sorry you thought the event was Ill planned, however we did announce the movie would be starting as soon as it got dark, which is what we did, we are sorry if we left room for confusion on our event description. We have recently started doing these events in the alley and any constructive criticism helps us get better for the next one. We hope you will be sticking with us as we better serve our customers with events and activities!

Thank You!
Tony Blanco
Co-Owner

text:
Going to give them another chance, of course...please don’t let me down Taco Bell!
I saw a whole bunch of 5/4 ⭐️ recent reviews and Inhope they are accurate and not just to bring their online rating up...we shall see...I will update after my visit.

You know for a long time I prayed for a Taco Bell to come to Randolph County.  Now we
have one, it has just continued to go downhill no matter how many times I give the Roanoke Taco Bell another chance!!  This time, like every one of the last three times I visited, the order was messed up!   This time I got what I ordered by name, but three little pieces of steak on the steak nachos and less than a half container of LIMP nacho fries and a reheated taco salad does NOT make a decent meal.  And yes, the line was moving like a snail...I thought maybe it was the guy up ahead ordering, but I am tired of making excuses for this Taco Bell!!!  Other Taco Bells don't have such crappy service and food!   Management,  if you are worth anything, figure out "who" the problems are and correct/fire them.  Here's a pic of the order of nacho fries, you be the judge...
Ps.  I'm the one that gave you a 4 Star rating right after you opened...smh.

text:
Service was a little slow. Apparently they were having computer issues that day. Will definitely try again to see if it improves. Food was excellent and exactly as ordered.

Edit: after a few weeks I was able to go back and retry this Taco Bell. Was definitely not impressed the second time around. Slower than the first time, and the restaurant was in bad need of some janitorial services. Trash all over the floor, tables that needed wiping down, and the staff was seemingly unconcerned with it. Definitely will not recommend this store until management has dealt with the problems.

name: Elle B
text: Worst drive up window blunder at a fast food restaurant. Very long line, gave wrong orders to customers, so the food was being handled and then handed back to be redistributed after being given to other customers, management CLOSED the store as in LOCKED the doors at 9:50 p.m. which is 2+ hours before normal closing time and refused to allow counter service during all the fiasco and we were told to get BACK in the drive up line and wait again to get our correct food, which by then was cold and soggy. Did not even make new food, gave us the food other customers had handled and returned and had been sitting in the bag all that time. The bean burrito was simply beans and tortilla, there was NO sauce, no diced onions, nothing. The taco supremes were not supreme at all there was no sour cream. Awful experience. Closing the store to avoid customers PRIOR to closing time was absurd.

name: John Paschal
text:
Drive thru handed HOT coffee to us in a regular drink cup. They were too lazy to go look and get the correct cups that had not yet been taken from the box.
Restaraunt has been filthy up until last 2 months. Overnight staff leaves trash and dirty tables for morning crew apparantly. Workers stand around while folks waiting to give their orders(service has improved in last month as well). The overall arrangement of drink machine, trash cans, and condiment bar could've been designed better also. Very excited to see taco bell come into my community. But disappointed to feel like I'm in a grungy, unmanaged environment.
Up until the last month these were issues.
Staff,and environment and the restaraunts cleanliness has improved since the first of the year. So hoping.

text: I had two separate orders, one was 4 taco Supremes and 3 drinks. On the tacos there was barely anything on there. My second order was a regular taco with NO lettuce, and a number 9 (crunchwrap supreme, a taco, and a large drink) and on that taco I wanted to add ONLY sour cream. And both tacos were given to me as supremes. The service was also terrible and slow and I was in the drive thru. I find it irresponsible, and lazy not to look at a screen to make sure all your orders are right or wrong, and if you notice that's it's wrong you should take the time to fix it not send it out just to get it back with a huge complaint that makes your store look terrible.
